Leaves: Initially in a rosette, each leaf 4-20 cm long and deeply lobed, but soon disappearing; stem leaves few, small and reduced.
Flowers: Yellow, of dandelion type with small tongue-shaped florets, in groups of 1-3, 3-4 mm diameter.
FruitSeeds: 8-10 mm long, naked, with parachuting hairs 6-7 mm long.
Habitat: Arid and semi-arid open scrubland and cropping land.
DistinguishingFeatures: Wiry, bare stems and deeply lobed, short-lived rosette on ground distinguish it from Wild lettuces (*Lactuca* species).
Impacts: Forms dense thickets, reduces crop yields.
